intro: Castilleja oresbia, commonly known as the redstem owl's-eye, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that resemble owl eyes. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on host plants for nutrients, often growing on grasses and other herbaceous species. Its blooming period typically occurs in late spring to early summer. Castilleja oresbia plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
